conclusion: Analyze the situation step by step to determine the time with induced current.
The frame is completely outside the magnetic field initially.
The frame starts entering the magnetic field when its front side reaches the left boundary.
Time taken for the front side to enter the magnetic field is \( t_1 = \frac{l}{v} \).
The frame is fully inside the magnetic field when its rear side enters.
Time taken for the frame to be completely inside the magnetic field is \( t_2 = \frac{l}{v} \).
The frame starts exiting the magnetic field when its front side reaches the right boundary.
Time taken for the front side to reach the right boundary is \( t_3 = \frac{d}{v} \).
The frame is completely outside the magnetic field when its rear side exits.
Time taken for the frame to be completely outside is \( t_4 = \frac{l}{v} \).
Induced current occurs from the moment the front side enters until the rear side exits.
Total time with induced current is \( t = t_1 + t_2 + t_3 + t_4 = \frac{l}{v} + \frac{l}{v} + \frac{d}{v} + \frac{l}{v} \).
Simplifying, the total time is \( t = \frac{3l + d}{v} \).
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is \(\frac{3l + d}{v}\).
